Actions.ActionName: Prevent user from running Settings Manager on its own

Actions.Title: The Settings Manager is not a standalone macro
Actions.Prompt:
Please use the Settings Manager by launching the main macro, then pressing Control while the delay box is onscreen.

If the Settings Manager is run directly, key variables aren't set, and it won't work properly.

Actions.Text:
__   Press Escape to cancel backup
backup__   Exit Settings Manager and run back up 
__1️⃣ BACKUPS ━━━━━━
buname__   Change folder name
buloc__   Change location (and move existing)
buqty__   How many to keep
links__   Use of hard links
delay__   Change delay before start
__2️⃣ INTERFACE ━━━━━━
dialog__   Manage onscreen information
timer__   Control how the task timer operates
timing__   Show or hide timing info in report
labels__   Enable or disable Finder labels

Actions.ActionName: Offer the option to reset invisible and duplicate warnings, if disabled

ThenActions.Text:
__3️⃣ OPERATION ━━━━━━
warn__    Reset the duplicates/invisibles warnings

ThenActions.ActionName: If export is in manual mode, offter chance to try automatic again

Actions.ActionName: Present the Settings Manager options list
Split the backup path for future use
Present renaming dialog until properly completed or canceled

Actions.Title: Please enter the new name for your backup folder
Actions.Prompt:
Note: The only safety checks provided for the new name are that it cannot begin with a period, nor contain a colon. Please use macOS-safe naming!

The current name is: %Variable%local_BUfolder%

Actions.Title: Your backup folder has been renamed...
Choose the folder where %Variable%local_BUfolder% will reside…
Actions.Prompt:
When the standard file browsing dialog appears, please select the folder that will hold %Variable%local_BUfolder%.

After selecting the new folder, you will be asked if you'd like to move your existing backups to the new location or not. If you choose not to move them, the next backup will be your first backup, and analysis will begin again with the next backup.

Current location: %Variable%rg_MBU_BackupLoc%

*** DO NOT USE A NETWORKED OR CLOUD DRIVE! ***
I have not tested the macro with such a setup, and I have no idea what may happen.

Actions.WindowTitle: Choose the folder that will store %Variable%local_BUfolder%

Actions.ActionName: Set temp var with location of old backup
Set global variable to the new backup folder location
Create the folder to hold the backups
And the folder for the database

Actions.Title: The backup folder has been changed…
Actions.Prompt:
All future backups will be placed here: %Variable%rg_MBU_BackupLoc%

Would you like to move your existing backups to this new location?

NOTE: It is *highly* recommended you have a backup of your backups before doing this, just in case something goes awry.

Actions.ActionName: Handle moving files across, if user requested that
Create the new alias via AppleScript
Actions.Text: set apscDone1 to falseset loopCount1 to 0repeat until apscDone1 is true or loopCount1 is 15	try				--if application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" is not running then tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" to launch				try			set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE"			tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"				set theLocation to getvariable "rg_MBU_BackupLoc"				set theFolderToAlias to getvariable "instance_NewestFolderName" instance kmInst			end tell						set myPath to theLocation & "/" & theFolderToAlias						tell application "Finder"				make new alias at POSIX file theLocation to POSIX file myPath				set name of result to "__latest"			end tell		end try				set apscDone1 to true	on error		set apscDone1 to false		set loopCount1 to loopCount1 + 1	end tryend repeat

ElseActions.Title: Copy failed!
ElseActions.Prompt:
The copy failed to verify. Please remove the files in the new backup location and try again. If this continues to fail, please get in touch with me on the Keyboard Maestro forums for assistance.

The macro will now exit.

ThenActions.Title: The backups copied successfully
ThenActions.Prompt:
The verification test passed; your copied backups are identical to the originals. Would you like the macro to delete the originals, or would you rather do that yourself?

If you choose to do it yourself, you'll be returned to the settings manager; if you choose to delete the originals, you'll see a message when that's done and then you'll return to the settings manager.

Yes => Delete the originals
No => Keep the originals

Actions.Title: MacroBackerUpper
Actions.Subtitle: Old backups deleted…
Actions.Text: You did have a backup of your backups, right??

Actions.ActionName: Set text based on current limit

ElseActions.Text:
You have a current cap of %Variable%instance_BackupQty% backups. Enter a new limit, or enter any negative number to not have a cap.

If you enter a cap that is lower than the number of backups you currently have, extra backups will be removed when the next backup runs.

ThenActions.Text: You currently do not have a limit on the number of backups. If you'd like to set a limit, enter a positive number, at least two or higher.

Actions.ActionName: Handle the input, trapping for bad data

Actions.Title: Set a new limit on the number of backups to keep
You must have at least two backups

Actions.ActionName: SQL: Update settings database with new value
Display one of two notifications depending on setting chosen

Actions.Title: MacroBackerUpper
Actions.Text: You set a negative backup limit, which means there is no limit—the macro will never remove any backup files.
Actions.Subtitle: Backup limit removed

Actions.Title: MacroBackerUpper
Actions.Text: Your new limit is %Variable%instance_BackupQty%. Backups over the limit will be removed on next backup.
Actions.Subtitle: Backup limit changed

Actions.ActionName: Create two different sets of text based on current setting

ElseActions.Title: Use of hard links
ElseActions.Prompt:
Your backups were not created using hard links—every file is on the drive multiple times, requiring much more drive space. Click Enable Hard Links to use them starting with the next backup (existing backups are not changed).

You'll save a lot of space going forward, though maintaining the hard links when you copy your backups to another drive is trickier. (You have to use rsync in Terminal; see the Read Me First! macro for more on that.)

Click Cancel to continue making full copy backups.

Actions.ActionName: SQL: Update settings database with new value

ThenActions.Title: Use of hard links
ThenActions.Prompt:
Your backups were created using space-saving hard links. Click Disable Hard Links to *not* use hard links on future backups (no existing backups will be modified.)

This will require much more drive space, but the resulting backups are more easily copied between machines without worrying about breaking hard links.

Click Cancel to leave hard links enabled.

Actions.ActionName: SQL: Update settings database with new value
Delay: Set length of delay before backup starts

Actions.Title: Pause for how long before beginning backup?
Actions.Prompt:
When launched, MacroBackerUpper pauses three seconds, which gives you time to enter the Settings Manager (and/or cancel the backup). You can change this delay to any number you like, as long as it's at least one (integers only, please).

Current setting: %Variable%instance_TimerDelay% seconds.

Actions.ActionName: SQL: Update settings database with new value
Progress list and summary dialog: When to show or hide

Actions.Text:
Always
Only if macro manually triggered
Never

Actions.ActionName: Remove the current setting from the list

Actions.Title: When to see onscreen progress and summary data?
Actions.Prompt:
During a backup, a task list shows the macro's progress, followed by a backup summary dialog when done. You can opt to have these two things always displayed (the default), only have them displayed when you trigger the macro manually, or to never see them.

Current setting: %Variable%instance_ShowDialog%

Pick one of the other two choices if you'd like to change it.

Actions.ActionName: SQL: Update settings database with new value
Translate instance var to dialog language
Remove the current setting from the list

Actions.Title: How much timing data would you like to see?
Actions.Prompt:
MacroBackerUpper tracks time taken during each part of the backup. You can choose how much of this data you'd like to see:

• Notification: You'll see one notification at the end (default).
• Window: As above, but in a window, not a notification.
• Silence: There is no end-of-run notification of any sort.
• All: Every task creates a notification—not recommended!

Current setting: %Variable%local_CurrentTimerOption%

Actions.ActionName: Translate answer into the timer's language
SQL: Update settings database with new value

Actions.Title: MacroBackerUpper
Actions.Text: The new setting is: %Variable%localTimerType__Choose an option%
Actions.Subtitle: Timing notification style changed

Actions.Title: Show detailed timing data in report?
Actions.Prompt: Currently, the saved report includes detailed timing on every task in the backup. Click Disable Timing to remove this, or Cancel to keep the timing data on the report.

Actions.Title: Show detailed timing data in report?
Actions.Prompt: Currently, the saved report does not include any detailed timing information. Click Enable Timing to add it to the next backup run's saved report, or click Cancel to leave things as they are.

Actions.ActionName: SQL: Update settings database with new value

Actions.Title: Use Finder labels to distinguish changes?
Actions.Prompt: Currently, Finder labels are enabled, so new macro groups are labeled in green, modified in yellow, etc. Click Disable Labels to turn Finder labels off for future backups, or click Cancel to leave them enabled.

Actions.Title: Use Finder labels to distinguish changes?
Actions.Prompt: Currently, Finder labels are disabled. If enabled, then new macro groups are labeled in green, modified in yellow, etc. Click Enable Labels to turn Finder labels on for future backups, or click Cancel to leave them disabled.

Actions.ActionName: SQL: Update settings database with new value
Update the settings in the database

Actions.Text:
UPDATE s_MacroBackerUpper SET Warn_Dupes = 'Yes';
UPDATE s_MacroBackerUpper SET Warn_Invisibles = 'Yes'

Actions.ActionName: SQL: Update settings database with new values

Actions.Title: Duplicate and invisibility warnings reset
Actions.Prompt: You will receive a warning if any such macros/groups are found on the next backup run.
